author: Anna Edgerton
description: Two people shot by a Customs and Border Patrol agent in Portland, Oregon, Thursday were associated with Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua, the city’s police chief said Friday, confirming an earlier account from the Trump administration.
title: Portland Police Confirm Gang Ties of Two Shot by Border Patrol

description: Rebecca Bill Chavez, Inter-American Dialogue President & CEO, discusses the possible competitive geopolitical factors that may have influenced the Trump administration's moves last weekend in Venezuela. She also talks about her concerns about the US possibly ruling Venezuela from afar, the security risks around the country, and how allies are watching what the administration does next. Rebecca speaks with Joe Mathieu and Tyler Kendall on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Did Competitive Geopolitical Factors Influence US Venezuela Move?

description: US Energy Secretary Chris Wright joins Bloomberg's "Balance of Power: Late Edition" on the Trump Administration's outline to work with top oil companies in Venezuela. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: One-on-One With Energy Secretary Chris Wright

description:
A House committee voted Wednesday to subpoena billionaire retail tycoon Les Wexner in its investigation of the late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
An email released by the Department of Justice last month revealed that law enforcement officials working on Epstein’s 2019 prosecution identified Wexner as one of 10 “co-conspirators.” Wexner wasn’t charged in the case. Representative Robert Garcia of California, the top-ranking Democrat on the House Oversight Committee, said he had secured the subpoena of Wexner. The executors of Epstein’s estate, Richard Kahn and Darren Indyke, also would be subpoenaed, he said. Bloomberg News Senior Investigative Reporter Jason Leopold joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss the subpoena, plus his latest FOIA Files Newsletter about data revealing DOGE hiring at the start of President Trump's second term. Leopold speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: House Committee Votes to Subpoena Wexner in Epstein Probe

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec discuss the latest on the Supreme Court. They also discuss today's economic data with Gregory Daco, Chief Economist at EY. They also discusses President Donald Trump proposed ban on institutional residential real estate purchases and push to make Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac buy $200 billion in mortgage bonds with Katie Hubbard, President of US Capital Markets at Walton Global. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Supreme Court Delays Trump Tariff Ruling | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 01/09/2026

author: David Gura, Rachael Lewis-Krisky
description: On today’s Big Take podcast: President Trump has big plans for Venezuela’s oil. What will it take to make them a reality?
title: The Trump Administration’s Case for Venezuela’s Oil

description: President Trump is betting big on Venezuela’s oil. On today’s Big Take podcast, David Gura and Bloomberg Opinion’s Javier Blas discuss the administration’s strategy, what it will take to get Venezuela pumping at capacity and the ripple effects for global energy markets. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: The Trump Administration’s Case for Venezuela’s Oil

author: Courtney McBride
description: President Donald Trump vowed to keep US forces in the Caribbean for the foreseeable future. Yet given the sheer size of the military buildup in Latin America, he can’t maintain that presence indefinitely — and there are tradeoffs.
title: US Force’s Presence in Caribbean Has Limits, Despite Trump Vow

description: Bloomberg's Will Wade explains the latest developments on Meta Platforms agreeing to multiple nuclear electricity deals to power new AI data centers. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Meta Signs Massive Nuclear Deals for AI Data Centers

description: Bloomberg's Erica Adelberg provides an update on President Trump's request to Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to purchase a substantial amount of debt in an effort to continue to apply pressure to the Federal Reserve for further interest rate cuts. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump to Fannie, Freddie: Buy $200B of Mortgage Debt

description: Bloomberg's Zoe Tillman gives the latest on the U.S. Supreme Court's first ruling of the new year, and when the decision regarding President Trump's sweeping tariffs could be made public. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Supreme Court Delays Ruling on Trump Tariffs For Now

author: Benoit Berthelot
description: French President Emmanuel Macron would dissolve the National Assembly and call a snap election if his political foes toppled his government, Finance Minister Roland Lescure said.
title: Macron to Call Snap Election If Government Falls, Lescure Says

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court will consider how much power the Securities and Exchange Commission has to recover illegal profits in a case that could blunt one of the agency’s most potent enforcement tools.
title: Supreme Court to Review SEC Power to Recoup Illegal Gains

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court will consider putting new limits on lawsuits against companies over atrocities abroad, agreeing to hear Cisco Systems Inc.’s bid to stop claims that it was complicit in China’s torture of Falun Gong adherents.
title: Supreme Court Will Consider New Curbs on Human-Rights Suits

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court will consider invalidating the Federal Communications Commission’s system for imposing financial penalties in a clash that could put fresh limits on the power of federal regulators.
title: Supreme Court to Weigh FCC Power to Fine in New Regulatory Clash

description: "We are going to do something on Greenland whether they like it or not," President Donald Trump says at the White House. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump on Greenland: We'll Make a Deal the Easy Way or the Hard Way

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President is seeking commitments from companies to restore production.
title: Trump Leans on Big Oil to Invest in Venezuela’s Oil Production

author: Myles Miller
description: FBI Director Kash Patel selected Christopher Raia, a career counter-terrorism official who led the investigation into the 2025 New Orleans New Year’s attack, as co-deputy director of the bureau.
title: Kash Patel Names FBI Agent Raia as Deputy After Bongino’s Exit

author: Vincent Lee
description: North Korea accused South Korea of violating its airspace after taking down a drone equipped with “surveillance devices,” denouncing Seoul for encroaching on its sovereignty.
title: North Korea Denounces S. Korea After Downing Alleged Spy Drone

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump ramped up his rhetoric over Greenland, saying he’s willing to secure the territory “the hard way” if authorities are unwilling to cut a deal for the US to take over the island.
title: Trump Says He’ll Get Deal on Greenland, ‘Easy Way’ or ‘Hard Way’

author: Eliyahu Kamisher
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom is asking for $200 million to restart offering tax rebates for electric vehicles that are purchased in the state, making up for a similar federal program that President Donald Trump ended last year.
title: Newsom Seeks $200 Million to Replace EV Tax Credits Cut by Trump

description: "We’re going to be making the decision as to which oil companies are going to go in," President Donald Trump says while predicting a quick agreement by major oil companies to spend at least $100 billion in Venezuela. He speaks during a White House meeting with nearly 20 oil industry executives. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Expects Big Oil to Agree on Venezuela Spending

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses President Donald Trump's meeting with oil executives at the White House. On today's show, former Chief of Staff to Vice President Mike Pence Marc Short, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis, Bellwether Government Affairs CEO Arshi Siddiqui and former White House Council of Economic Advisers Member Heather Boushey. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Meets Energy Execs on Venezuela | Balance of Power: Early Edition 1/09/2026

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: Major US oil executives expressed caution to Donald Trump about reentering Venezuela, even as the president pressured their companies to spend at least $100 billion to revive the country’s production following the brazen capture of leader Nicolás Maduro.
title: Oil Firms Lukewarm on Venezuela Return Despite Trump Pressure

description: Marc Short, former chief of staff to Vice President Mike Pence, says that the 17 House Republicans who voted with Democrats to extend Affordable Care Act subsidies are making a political calculation that they care more about being reelected than getting 'yelled at by Donald Trump.' As more funding bills take shape in congress, Short says that he thinks it is unlikely the government will shut down again at the end of the month.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Lawmakers Putting Midterm Hopes Over Trump Fears, Says Marc Short

author: Maxwell Adler, Andrew Oxford
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom proposed a $349 billion budget for the fiscal year that begins in July that leans on steadier economic growth and resilient financial markets to keep the state’s projected deficit to about $3 billion, a far smaller gap than earlier estimates.
title: California’s Newsom Looks to Increase Budget by $11 Billion

description: US President Donald Trump said a second wave of attacks on Venezuela has been canceled, citing improved cooperation from the country after some political prisoners were released. Kasia Klimasinska reports. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Calls Off Second Attack on Venezuela

description: Congress is back in session and taking up the issue of Affordable Care Act subsidies — again. On today’s Big Take podcast: What’s at stake for millions of Americans if lawmakers can’t reach a deal. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Congress Revisits Fight Over Affordable Care Act Subsidies

description:
Venezuela is sitting on, by some measures, the biggest oil reserves in the world. And yet in the immediate wake of Nicolás Maduro's capture by US forces, the actual price of oil has moved very little.

Gregory Brew, a senior analyst at the Eurasia Group, joins Tracy Alloway and Joe Weisenthal on the Odd Lots podcast to discuss what it takes to restart production in the country and why it may be more profitable to invest elsewhere. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Will Maduro’s Removal Lead to a Venezuelan Oil Revival?

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Friday he is discussing a potential free-trade agreement with the US as part of a broader prosperity package aimed at propelling the country’s recovery after the war.
title: Zelenskiy Says Trump Should Make Free-Trade Deal With Ukraine

author: David Alire Garcia
description: Venezuela’s new leader isn’t backing down from her assertion that the US orchestrated an illegal kidnapping with its seizure of President Nicolás Maduro, but she’s also seeking more diplomatic engagement with Donald Trump.
title: Venezuela Seeks Closer US Ties While Denouncing Maduro Capture

description: Heather Boushey, who served on the Council of Economic Advisers in the Biden administration, said today's "lackluster" jobs report, while not terrible, indicates the labor market remains tepid for those who are looking for work. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: 'Lackluster' Jobs Report Tough for Fed, Says Heather Boushey

author: Sarah Jacob
description: Three Dutch parties including election winner Rob Jetten’s center-left Democrats 66 announced plans to form a minority government, signaling headway in coalition talks.
title: Dutch Election Winner Jetten Seeks to Form Minority Government

description: The schools in Montclair, New Jersey, are facing a deficit of nearly $18 million. Some residents of the New York City suburb worry that leaving it to taxpayers to clean up the mess could make living there unaffordable. Bloomberg's Erin Hudson joins Paul Sweeny Scarlet Fu and John Tucker to discuss. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Montclair Housing Boom Collides With $18 Million School Crisis

author: Andrea Palasciano, Sanne Wass, Kirsi Heikel
description: Denial, dread and now panicked action are spreading across Europe as it comes to grips with a once-unthinkable reality: The system that has protected Europeans since they last descended into world war suddenly hinges on what Donald Trump does with a sparsely populated and mostly ice-covered island thousands of miles away.
title: Trump’s Greenland Grab Triggers Incredulity Then Panic in Europe

description:
General Motors Co. will take another $6 billion in charges tied to production cutbacks in its electric vehicle and battery operations as the financial fallout spreads from the weakening US market for EVs.
The announcement Thursday brings the total writedowns from GM’s huge bet on battery-electric cars to $7.6 billion, following smaller charges revealed in October.  Bloomberg's Craig Trudell reports. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: GM’s EV Charges Balloon to $7.6 Billion as US Demand Craters

author: Zoe Schneeweiss, Viktoria Dendrinou
description: Six countries have placed bids for the vice presidency of the European Central Bank, putting nations from the euro area’s periphery in competition for one of the region’s key economic posts.
title: ECB’s No. 2 Job Attracts Bids From Six Euro-Area Countries

author: Maya Averbuch
description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum called for greater coordination with the US on security after Donald Trump’s latest threats to attack drug cartels on land.
title: Mexico Seeks Conciliation After Trump Threatens Land Strikes

author: Kari Lundgren
description: Equinor ASA said its Empire Wind project faces “likely termination” if the Trump administration’s decision to halt construction on its offshore wind farm stands.
title: Equinor Warns of Empire Wind Termination If Trump Halt Stands

description: Venezuela's then-Vice President Delcy Rodriguez (now acting president) discussing US relations and sanctions, her country's economy, government programs, frozen assets, response to Covid-19, and its potential for debt repayment. She spoke exclusively in Caracas with Bloomberg's Erik Schatzker in June 2021. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Venezuela's Acting President Delcy Rodriguez in 2021 Interview

author: Sridhar Natarajan, Josh Wingrove, Katy O'Donnell
description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick recently met with executives from major homebuilding companies, according to people familiar with the matter, part of President Donald Trump’s push to bolster his standing with voters on the economy.
title: Lutnick Met Homebuilders as Trump Dials Up Affordability Push

author: Alex Wickham, Ellen Milligan
description: The UK urged its European NATO allies to step up their security presence in the High North as part of a diplomatic effort by Prime Minister Keir Starmer to convince President Donald Trump he doesn’t need to take over Greenland.
title: UK Rallies Arctic Efforts in Bid to Talk Trump Down on Greenland

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Josh Wingrove, Courtney Subramanian, Kevin Crowley, Mia Gindis
description: Ejecutivos del sector energético prevén un largo camino por delante, pero les preocupa que se les obligue a prometer una solución rápida.
title: Trump pide a las grandes petroleras ir a Venezuela: “Háganlo por el país”

author: Yizhu Wang
description: The six giants of US banking are expected to post their second-highest annual profit ever — a $157 billion haul — after riding out President Donald Trump’s dramatic policy changes.
title: Six Banks Seen Reaping $157 Billion on Trump’s Return

description: President Donald Trump posted a chart on social media Thursday evening that included figures in the yet-to-be released December employment report. The chart matched figures that were not publicly published until Friday. Mike McKee reports on "Bloomberg Open Interest." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Posted Unpublished Jobs Data Early

author: Reade Pickert
description: President Donald Trump posted a chart on social media Thursday evening that included figures in the yet-to-be released December employment report.
title: Trump Posted Unpublished Jobs Data Early in Social Media Post

description: US Deputy Secretary of Labor Keith Sonderling says jobs are being added in the right spots, pointing out that the private sector is growing. Sonderling also expects more manufacturing jobs to come back to the US. Employers overall added fewer jobs than expected in December.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Added Jobs in Right Places, Says Deputy Secretary of Labor

author: Golnar Motevalli
description: On Thursday night, 35-year-old Sara took to the streets of Tehran for the first time in three years to protest against the Islamic Republic.
title: Iran’s Growing Unrest Is Now a Grave Crisis for Islamic Republic

author: Patrick Sykes, Golnar Motevalli
description: Iranian officials intensified a crackdown on protests across the country, threatening participants with the death penalty amid expectations of further unrest on Friday night.
title: Iran Threatens Protesters With Death Penalty as Crackdown Grows

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court didn’t rule on challenges to President Donald Trump’s tariffs Friday, leaving markets in suspense on the fate of the administration’s signature economic policy.
title: Supreme Court Doesn’t Issue Trump Tariffs Ruling Friday

author: Josh Wingrove
description: Donald Trump’s administration is ready to use other authorities to quickly reimpose tariffs if the Supreme Court strikes down the president’s global levies, National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett said.
title: Trump Ready to Pivot If Court Overturns Tariffs, Aide Says

author: Sanne Wass, Sara Sjolin
description: There’s no sum of money from Donald Trump that would persuade Greenlanders to join the US, two Greenlandic lawmakers in the Danish parliament said.
title: No Amount of Money Can Buy Greenland, Lawmakers Tell Trump

author: Ari Natter
description: The Trump administration is unlikely to provide financial support to help US oil companies revitalize Venezuela’s oil sector, Interior Secretary Doug Burgum said Friday, throwing cold water on hopes the multibillion-dollar effort would be subsidized by the US government.
title: Venezuela Oil Revival Won’t Rely on Funding From US, Burgum Says

author: Ellen Milligan
description: While senior British officials warn the country has entered “a new era of threats,” they’re working to slash the workforce charged with countering those dangers.
title: UK Budget Cuts Spark ‘Hunger Games’ Culture Among Diplomats

author: Alexandra Semenova
description: US equities pushed higher on Friday, as December’s employment report did little to alter expectations for leaving interest rates on hold. Meanwhile, the Supreme Court did not deliver a highly awaited decision on the legality of President Donald Trump’s tariffs.
title: US Stocks Rise Following Jobs Data, No Ruling on Trump Tariffs

description: Interior Secretary Doug Burgum says US oil companies are very interested in revitalizing Venezuela's oil sector. But he says the Trump administration is unlikely to subsidize their efforts. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Won't Subsidize Oil Companies Returning to Venezuela, Burgum Says

author: Selcan Hacaoglu, Faseeh Mangi, Firat Kozok
description: Turkey is seeking to join the defense alliance between Saudi Arabia and nuclear-armed Pakistan, according to people familiar with the matter, paving the way for a new security alignment that could shift the balance of power in the Middle East and beyond.
title: Turkey Said to Seek Membership of Saudi-Pakistan Defense Pact

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Sonia Sirletti
description: Italy’s Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said the government is open to selling its remaining Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA, even though there is “no rush” to do so.
title: Meloni Open to Eventual Sale of Italy’s Remaining Paschi Stake

author: Sam Dagher
description: Members of a southern Yemeni faction that led a failed secession attempt last month announced from Saudi Arabia that it had dissolved — though the move was declared illegitimate by the group’s leadership in the United Arab Emirates.
title: Yemen’s UAE-Backed Group Says to Wind Up in Contested Statement

author: Antony Sguazzin
description: Leo Brent Bozell III, a conservative activist and writer, has been sworn in as the US’s ambassador to South Africa.
title: US’s Bozell Sworn in as Ambassador to South Africa

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump is set to outline his vision for rebuilding Venezuela’s battered oil sector Friday in a meeting with representatives from 17 energy companies, including crude producers, refiners and commodity traders.
title: Trump to Meet Energy Executives, Outline Plan for Venezuela

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Kyiv’s mayor made an unprecedented call to residents to seek temporary refuge outside the Ukrainian capital after a Russian aerial barrage triggered widespread shortages amid frigid temperatures.
title: Kyiv Mayor Urges Freezing Residents to Leave as Russia Attacks

author: Michal Kubala
description: Czech President Petr Pavel explained his longstanding refusal to appoint the government’s candidate for environment minister, in a sign of escalating tensions with billionaire premier Andrej Babis.
title: Czech President Cites Racism in Refusal to Appoint Key Minister

author: Jonas Ekblom
description: Investors are betting that a political battle over Greenland is good for the Arctic territory’s business, making a tiny bank located on the island into one of Europe’s best performing stocks in the early days of 2026.
title: Tiny Greenland Lender Jumps 40% as Trump Fuels Investor Bonanza

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni said Europe should engage with Russia over Ukraine, a pivot in her foreign policy that aligns her with recent comments from French President Emmanuel Macron.
title: Italy’s Meloni Calls on Europe to Reach Out to Russia Over Peace

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana, Pathom Sangwongwanich
description: Thailand is set to impose limits on speculative trading in gold as authorities step up efforts to curb the influence of a record-breaking rally in the precious metal on the nation’s currency.
title: Thailand Weighs Curbs on Speculative Gold Trading to Shield Baht

author: Lyubov Pronina, Donato Paolo Mancini, Andrea Palasciano
description: European Union countries backed a trade deal with the so-called Mercosur bloc of countries in South America, paving the way for the EU to sign its largest free-trade agreement next week.
title: EU Nations Back Mercosur Trade Deal Over French Opposition

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: President Lee’s warm meeting with his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, was only the prelude to a tough Japan visit next week.
title: South Korea Tests Diplomacy’s Limits With Its China Entente

author: John Liu, Fran Wang
description: China will cancel or reduce tax rebates on hundreds of products as Beijing seeks to reassure trade partners concerned about surging Chinese exports.
title: China to Cut Export Tax Rebates to Ease Global Trade Tensions

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni spoke out on Friday against any attempt by the US to control Greenland.
title: Meloni Pushes Back Against American Threats to Seize Greenland

author: Kamailoudini Tagba
description: President Emmanuel Macron called for a renewed push by French companies and financiers into Africa, arguing that excessive regulation and corporate caution have allowed rivals to displace France from markets it once dominated.
title: Macron Presses French Companies to Revive Investment in Africa

author: Nancy Cook
description: From immigration to Latin America policy, the White House adviser excels at channeling the president’s desires.
title: Inside the White House, Stephen Miller Is Making His Vision of America Real

author: Kok Leong Chan, Ram Anand
description: The United Malays National Organisation, which for decades dominated Malaysian politics and remains a key member of the ruling coalition, is set to renew a push for the release of jailed former Prime Minister Najib Razak next week, even as it steps back from threats to quit the government.
title: Malaysia’s UMNO to Press for Najib Release But Stay in Coalition

author: Erin Hudson
description: Property values in the New York suburb soared during the pandemic. A vote on whether to raise taxes to close a school deficit is now testing both new and longtime residents.
title: Montclair’s $18 Million School Crisis Leaves Taxpayers on the Hook

author: Rachel Evans
description: US President Donald Trump said a second wave of attacks on Venezuela has been canceled, citing improved cooperation from the country.
title: Trump Cancels Second Attack on Venezuela, Cites Cooperation

author: Samy Adghirni
description: France accused the US of wielding trade coercion and sanctions to weaken European unity and sovereignty, as Foreign Minister Jean-Noel Barrot warned that Europe faces mounting external threats.
title: France Warns That Europe Is Under Threat From US Coercion

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Philip Heijmans
description: A senior US envoy urged Cambodia and Thailand to preserve a fragile ceasefire along their disputed border, pledging funding to support the truce as well as demining and efforts to combat transnational crime.
title: US Offers Millions to Support Cambodia-Thailand Ceasefire

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

On today's show, US President Donald Trump says the US military is preparing for strikes against drug cartel facilities in Venezuela. His comments on Fox News come just days after capturing president Nicolas Maduro and would mark a significant escalation in the region.

Rio Tinto is in talks to buy Glencore in a deal that will create the world’s largest mining firm with a market value exceeding $200 billion. 

Today's guests: Origin Advocacy Principal Halie Craig, Middlesex University Interim Faculty Dean for Science and Technology, Klaus Dodds & Head of Investment Strategy for RBC Wealth Management in the British Isles and Asia, Frédérique Carrier (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Signals Land Strikes on Cartels After Maduro Operation | Daybreak Europe 1/9/2026

description: Peter Navarro is the architect of US President Donald Trump’s trade war. He talks to Mishal Husain about US-China relations and an upcoming Supreme Court ruling that could unravel many Trump tariffs. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: The Economist Behind Trump’s Trade War

author: Firat Kozok
description: Turkey will stick with a tight economic policy stance despite signs of easing inflation, Vice President Cevdet Yilmaz said, pushing back against expectations that disinflation will prompt a loosening of policy.
title: Turkish Vice President Vows to Maintain Tight Economic Policy

description: Peter Navarro, White House trade adviser, says the European Union should "follow the US and Mexican lead" in imposing higher tariffs on China. He made the comments in an interview on The Mishal Husain Show. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Navarro Urges EU to Impose Higher Tariffs on China

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said a trade deal with India did not materialize last year because Prime Minister Narendra Modi did not call President Donald Trump.
title: Modi’s Failure to Call Trump Derailed Trade Deal, Lutnick Says

author: Sotiris Nikas, Paul Tugwell
description: The US doesn’t like Beijing’s ownership of the country’s biggest port, so it’s trying to come up with an alternative plan.
title: Trump’s Rivalry With China Plays Out in a Sleepy Greek Port

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Giorgia Meloni has made a career out of confounding the skeptics. Having emerged as a force beyond Italy, the country’s first female prime minister now confronts two stubborn domestic obstacles standing between her and a potentially historic tenure: stagnant living standards and a political system that tends toward deadlock.
title: Meloni Made Italy a Force. Now She Wants to Cement Her Own Power

author: Jana Randow
description: The woman who calls herself Europe’s “Mrs. Crisis” is approaching the final stretch of her career with the world barely recognizable from the one she once knew.
title: Call Me Mrs. Crisis: Lagarde Confronts Europe’s Perils in Last Act

description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde has insisted she’s not interested in returning to French politics and making a bid in the presidential elections due in just 15 months. Lagarde spoke with Bloomberg's Francine Lacqua about Europe’s fragility, rising populism and how she stays calm during global shocks. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: ECB President Lagarde Rules Out French Presidential Bid

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korea’s government is a little more optimistic about the economy’s prospects than the central bank, striking a more upbeat tone as authorities move to further open the nation’s currency and financial markets to global investors.
title: South Korea Signals Better Growth as It Moves to Open FX Market

author: Colum Murphy
description: China is ramping up objections to what it sees as Japan’s desire to acquire nuclear weapons, despite Tokyo’s longstanding renunciation of such arms, deepening another fissure in the two neighbors’ increasingly tense ties.
title: China Widens Attack on Japan ‘Nuclear Ambitions’ as Ties Worsen

description: Francine Lacqua speaks to Christine Lagarde about Europe’s fragility, rising populism and how she stays calm during global shocks. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Inside Europe’s Economic Crises With Lagarde

author: Golnar Motevalli
description: Protests in Iran escalated significantly overnight amid an internet blackout, as thousands appeared to take to the streets across the country including the capital Tehran, according to unverified social media videos.
title: Iran Protests Intensify Amid Nationwide Internet Blackout

author: Peter Blumberg
description: A lawyer representing Nicolas Maduro has moved to strike a former top Justice Department lawyer during the Reagan administration, Bruce Fein, from serving on the ousted Venezuelan president’s criminal defense team.
title: Maduro Attorney Says Ex-DOJ Lawyer Unauthorized to Join Defense

author: Philip Heijmans
description: Singapore lawmakers are poised to debate if Pritam Singh should remain Leader of the Opposition when Parliament meets next week after his conviction for lying to a parliamentary committee.
title: Singapore to Mull Opposition Chief’s Role After Lying Conviction

author: Robert Burnson
description: New York, California and three other Democratic-led states sued the Trump administration in a bid to restore $10 billion in federal aid for child care and other services for poor families.
title: New York Challenges Trump’s $10 Billion Cuts in Child Care Aid

author: Nectar Gan
description: As the world digests the implications of the US capture of Venezuela’s leader, China has ramped up its messaging, touting its governance model as a superior alternative to Western capitalism and representing a new path for developing countries to follow.
title: China Touts Its Governance Model as Trump Tests Global Norms

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Catherine Lucey
description: US President Donald Trump said he planned to meet with Venezuelan opposition leader and Nobel Peace Prize recipient María Corina Machado as soon as next week, as he weighs the future governance of the nation following the weekend operation to capture strongman Nicolas Maduro.
title: Trump Set to Meet Machado in Opening for Venezuela’s Opposition

author: Catherine Lucey, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said the US military was preparing for strikes against drug cartel facilities, just days after he ordered an operation to capture Venezuelan strongman Nicolas Maduro.
title: Trump Signals Land Strikes On Cartels After Maduro Operation

author: Crayton Harrison
description: Venezuela released a close ally of opposition leader María Corina Machado, a gesture of the interim government’s cooperation with the Trump administration.
title: Venezuela Frees Close Aide to Nobel Winner Machado From Prison

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan called for smooth shipments of food and rare earths following reports that Beijing is hindering trade on those goods as the dispute between Asia’s two largest economies escalates.
title: Japan Calls for Smooth Trade With China for Rare Earths, Food

author: Anna Edgerton
description: Two people were shot by federal agents on Thursday in Portland, Oregon, according to local police.
title: Federal Agents Involved in Shooting of Two People in Portland, Oregon

author: Daniel Flatley
description: The US Treasury is preparing to announce a crackdown on money services businesses in Minnesota as part of an ongoing probe into fraud and alleged money laundering in the state, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said in an interview with Fox News on Thursday.
title: Bessent Ramps Up Minnesota Scrutiny With Money Services Probe

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: A Seoul court began a final hearing for former President Yoon Suk Yeol over his botched declaration of martial law in 2024, with prosecutors set to seek either the death penalty or a life sentence for the impeached leader.
title: South Korea Court Holds Final Hearing for Yoon Over Martial Law

description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Rep. Nick LaLota (R-NY) & Rep. Ryan Mackenzie (R-PA) discuss why they voted yes on the House vote to pass the Obamacare extensions. Rep. Greg Stanton (D-AZ) and Rep. Madeleine Dean (D-PA) share their expectations on the Senate's next steps following the vote. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: House Passes Bill to Extend ACA Tax Credits | Balance of Power: Late Edition 01/08/2026

author: Sinead Cruise, Silas Brown
description: A prominent group of lawmakers from the UK’s House of Lords has criticized the Treasury for its “limited grasp” of risks related to the boom in private capital markets and said that the Bank of England needs to move faster in its plans for stress testing the sector.
title: Lords Report Slams UK Treasury for Apathy to Private Credit Risk
